alert.note: Alert for Jones; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jones, southwestern Lenoir, northwestern Onslow and northeastern Duplin Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pleasant Hill, or 14 miles south of Kinston, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kinston, Deep Run, Pleasant Hill, Wyse Fork, Pink Hill, Sandy Bottom and Hargetts Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
